title: "Parking" sign, seen in Barcelona
content:
Does anybody know what type is this?

thanks a lot!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100103065120im_/http:/typophile.com/files/IMG_0428_4957.jpg)
author: alexandracama

comments.content:
I remember looking for this one, and I tried it again today. Still no luck. You would think with this K and G that it would be easy, but I can’t find it. Why someone would use a custom font, or custom lettering, for a Parking garage puzzles me, but maybe that’s what they did.

- Mike Yanega

You might try looking through the specimens of foundries that feature Cyrillic type, since that script favors structures like that “K”.

hhp

<cite>Why someone would use a custom font, or custom lettering, for a Parking garage puzzles me</cite>

Signmakers have probably their own typefaces, unchanged and untouched in the years.  
From where is the sign, Germany?

\> _You might try looking through the specimens of foundries that feature Cyrillic type, since that script favors structures like that “K”._

That N as well, isn’t it? The stress indicates it may be a mirrored capital letter I.
